Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's Mom.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What?  What is it?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She's not here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Whatta you mean she's not here?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She...she died.  It's like it just happened.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: She just died, your mother just died?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No Dad, it happened a long time ago, a long time ago for me.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: When?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Jesus Christ...that's...ten days from now.  How?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She was murdered.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Murdered?  Why?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: There was this case.  A serial.  He murdered three women, all nurses, between '68 and '69.  The papers called them the Nightingale Murders.  They never caught him.  But the killings just stopped.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What kinda twisted animal.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Dad, we did something.  Something to make it worse.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Whatta you mean...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He didn't just kill three women anymore. He killed ten.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Something we did changed the case...changed history.  Mom wasn't dead.  But then after you didn't die in the fire something must have happened.  And this guy, this Nightingale guy, he kept on killing...it was like a spree...seven more women.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I gotta take her away, John.  I'm gonna take your mother away.  He can't hurt her if I take her away.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I don't know...  What about the other women?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I'll warn them.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That'll never work.  They'll just think you're crazy.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What can we do?  You don't even know who this guy is.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No.  Nobody got...  Wait a minute.  I might not know who he is, but I know where he's gonna be.  I got the case file.  We know what he's gonna do before he does it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: So what should I do?  Call the police? You think they'll believe me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: They will if they catch him in the act. You can make that happen, Dad.  You can tail the victim and call it in at just the right moment.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I don't know, John.  I'm a fire fighter. This is...this is different.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I do know.  I'm a cop.  This is what I do.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What if the radio stops working?  Christ, what if I can't reach you again?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Then you get Mom the hell out.  But Dad, those other women weren't supposed to die.  We don't try to stop this guy, we're gonna live with that for the rest of our lives.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What do I gotta do?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: The next victim was Karen Reynolds...It happens tomorrow.  Case file says she left St. Vincents at six.  Show'd up at Cozy's Bar around six thirty.  She walked outta that bar around seven-thirty.  They found her dead in an empty lot behind the place at eight o'clock.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Why not just get the cops to watch the bar?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: They'll question her.  Whatever they tell her could change what happens.  No, I want you to follow her.  See if anybody's watching her, hittin' on her. I'm betting somebody's gonna walk outta that bar with her.  When they do, you call the cops.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Hey, Chuck.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Hey, Karen.

Speaker: young detective
Dialogue: Is that really how you got the Son of Sam?  Parking tickets?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Any word on our bones?

Speaker: young detective
Dialogue: But how'd you think of it?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: You're pulling over with a .44 bulldog tucked in your pants getting ready to blow somebody's brains out...I  figure the last thing you're thinking about is alternate side of the street parking.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That's what we need here, Satch.  A lucky break.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: That wasn't luck, Johnny boy.  That was smarts and ten plus on the job.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: From the girls, pal.  All of 'em.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I was, uh, I'm not really...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: A married fireman.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Frank.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Do I know you?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Mr. Lee make you pay for those veggies.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I follow fires, nothing else.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yeah, it was a close call, but...

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Close!  The news said it was a miracle you guys got out alive!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Close is just close if you're still alive to talk about it, y'know/

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Our lucky break.  Mario ID'd the dental. Mary Finelli...reported missing April 16,

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: April 16...?  That means she was the first.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Which means he probably knew her.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: This case just got hot.  We pull on this string...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Dad...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You wanna tuck the monster in and join me?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: There's something I gotta take care of. Something I need to tell you about.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Okay...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I've been talking to this...guy...this cop...on the HAM...and, uh, he...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Honey, what is it?  Just tell me.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I've been talking to Johnny...on the radio.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I know.  He loves that thing.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No.  Not our Johnny.  I mean, it's Johnny...but not now...in the future.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Sounds like fun.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I'm serious.

Speaker: john's voice
Dialogue: Karen Reynolds is alive and well.  We did it, Dad.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Did you see him?  Do you know who he is?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No.  I just kept talking to her.  There was a lot of guys in that bar - could'a been any of 'em.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's okay.  This is working.  This is gonna work.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Whatta we do now?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She's a nursing student.  Paying her way as a cocktail waitress at the Peppermint Lounge, on west 63rd.  Left work at two A M...killed in her apartment, between two thirty and five.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Got it.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Dad, I think I may be able to get you enough information to make sure the DA can nail this bastard.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Coupla days ago they dug up a body in Washington Heights - Mary Finelli.  Girl disappeared in '68.  Turns out she was his first kill.  Which means he probably knew her.  Most serials know their first victim.  I'm gonna do some checking - see if I can put any of this together...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: All right, I'm with you.  I just hope we know what the hell we're doing.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Well they found out cigarettes give you lung cancer.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What else, John.  It must be different, huh?  Are people living on the moon?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Didn't happen, we got enough problems down here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What are we like in...1998?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We're okay...we're good, Dad.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hey, what about the Amazin's?  They pull it off?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You really wanna know?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yeah, you betcha.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Well, game five was the big one.  It turned in the bottom of the 6th.  We were down 3-0.  Cleon Jones gets hit on the foot - left a scuff mark on the ball. Clendenon comes up.  The count goes to 2 2.  High fastball.  He nailed it.  Weis slammed a solo shot in the 7th to tie. Jones and Swoboda scored in the 8th.  We won, Pop.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You there?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Jules, I want you to say hello to somebody...  I'm on with John - that guy I told you about.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: The future guy?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yeah, but, no kidding around, he's a good guy, a real good guy...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: H-hi.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Hey, future boy.  Frank tells me you're a cop?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah, that's right.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: My six year-old here keeps telling me he wants to be a policeman.  Right after he retires from the majors.  We just gave him a badge and a whistle for his birthday.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah...I remember.  I used to play cops and robbers but y-- ...my mom wouldn't let me have a toy gun.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You're mom sounds like she's got some smarts.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She's pretty special.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Are you a good cop, John?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I try to be.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Then I'll bet she's real proud of you, huh?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah.  I just wish I'd told her how proud I was of her.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I didn't realize...  But she knew, John.  A mother knows what's in her son's heart.

Speaker: gordo
Dialogue: I wanna talk on the radio.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Gordo?

Speaker: gordo
Dialogue: How'd you know my name, mister?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hey, Gordo.  My name is Santa Clause. And I'm gonna give you the biggest Christmas present you ever had.

Speaker: gordo
Dialogue: I better give you my address then.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Oh don't worry kid, I know where you live.  Now I want you to go upstairs and write this down, buy Yahoo. You got that Space Cowboy.  Y-a-h-o-o. It's a magic word and I never want you to forget it.

Speaker: gordo
Dialogue: You got a deal, mister.  I mean Santa.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: John, you still there?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm right here, Dad.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You all right?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah, I think so...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Don't worry, Chief.  I'm not gonna let anything happen to her...no matter what.

Speaker: john's voice
Dialogue: Can I keep these for a little while?

Speaker: finelli
Dialogue: Detectives' been through that stuff already back then.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Promise.

Speaker: finelli
Dialogue: Mary volunteered over at St. Vincents' after school.  She loved it...was going to become a doctor.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Okay, lemme walk you through it.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Mind if I shake it off first...so's I can concentrate better.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Three guys show up in both the yearbook and diary.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: The third one is Daryl Adams.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: So you figure the murders stop 'cause he's off the street.  Then by the time he gets paroled, he's smartened up enough to control himself?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Not the first time that's been true.  I'm telling you, I got a feeling about this guy.  This is the guy, Satch.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Uh, huh.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: I'm just trying to figure what interests me more: the possibility that Daryl is the guy, or you making him absolutely the guy.

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: That was over thirty years ago.  I paid for that and then some.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You go to Xavier High School, Daryl?

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You remember Mary Finelli?

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: What are you saying?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You know what I'm saying.

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: No, I don't.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Well, I think you do.

Speaker: sissy
Dialogue: Give me a couple Bloodys, Gus, and a Dewars on the rocks.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Just fine.  You?

Speaker: sissy
Dialogue: Right now, just fine.  Ask me later, fireman.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Sexual assault, Daryl.  Five years.  But you got lucky, right?  You got away with something else.  Something you figured nobody knows about.

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: What I know is what I told you.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Let me tell you what I know, Daryl.  You went to Saint Xavier with Mary.  You lived five blocks from her.  You liked her.  But she ain't interested.  That must've hurt, huh?

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: So what?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: So, what'd you do about it, Daryl?

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You spare a smoke?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I'm trying to quite.  Turns out those things'll kill you.

Speaker: daryl
Dialogue: Oh, my God!  What is that?!  Why you showing me this shit!?  JESUS!  JESUS! Get those away from me!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Nicky Moore.  Patty Ryan.  Mary Finelli. These names mean anything to you, asshole?  Julia Sullivan!  She mean anything?  She means something to me!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: You fight fires, honey?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yep.  That's what I do.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I bet you do.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Last call.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: I gotta take a leak.  You need to use the head?  You can, y'know.  If you want to.

Speaker: sissy
Dialogue: See you, Fireman.  Don't talk so much next time.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You know, Daryl, sometimes, despite all the training we cops go through. Despite all that we are taught about right and wrong.  Despite all that we would like to honor in ourselves, we can come to a place where we don't give a fuck.  Know what I mean?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: John.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah.  Sure.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: He ain't our guy, John.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Just cause he didn't want to look at the photos doesn't mean he isn't the doer. Not everyone fits the profile.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: If he was gonna give something up he would'a done it already.

Speaker: killer
Dialogue: You following me?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Mary Finelli...

Speaker: killer
Dialogue: Who the fuck are you?

Speaker: killer
Dialogue: Yeah.  He just needs a little time kissing the porcelain.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: OPEN UP, OPEN THE DOOR...ah...ummm...THIS IS THE POLICE.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He killed her John.  He killed her and I didn't do a thing to stop it.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's not your fault, Dad.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yes it is...we did this.  We changed everything.  I was supposed to die in that warehouse.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: This is wrong...it's like we cheated...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I know...  But Dad, you can't go back.  You didn't die in that fire.  And no matter what you do, nothing is gonna change that.  So all we can do is deal with this...and try to make it right.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I don't think I can.  I'm not a cop.  I can't.   I can't stop this guy.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: But we can, we can do it together. Spirit and guts, remember?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Johnny, I know, but...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I need you to believe in me.  To believe that we can do this.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: John, he's got my driver's license.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He took my driver's license, John, he knows where we live.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He took your wallet?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No, he tossed the wallet, but he kept the license.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He touched your wallet!  Where's your wallet?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: In my pocket.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We got him!  Dad you got him!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: His prints.  You've got his prints.  I'll run them through criminal index.  You gotta get me that wallet.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: How the hell am I gonna do that?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Listen to me, very carefully, take your wallet out, just touch it on the corners.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Please, Dad, just do it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay, okay...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Right, now I need you to tape it up on the outside, where he touched it, so the prints keep.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Then you gotta hide it somewhere. Somewhere where nobody's gonna find it...for 29 years!  Put it under the loose floorboard by the window!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I gotcha, I gotcha Chief!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's gonna work, Dad.  We're gonna stop him.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hang on.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We're in business.  Just sit tight...and don't worry.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: What are you talkin' about?  I know this prick.  He worked outta Brooklyn North.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He never died...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Just came by to wrap up over there. Thought I'd say "hello."

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Glad you did.  Come on in.  Buy you a cup of coffee?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Wife around?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: No.  No.  Well, sort of.  In my heart. Been dead 29 years.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Oh.  Sorry.  How so?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Happens that way sometimes.  Son still on the job?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You used to be on the job?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Yeah, long time ago.  I know you?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I look familiar?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: No.  What house you work?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: A hot shot, huh?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Nah, just working the job.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: I hear that.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: As a matter of fact, I caught a case that goes back to your day...one of the Nightingale murders.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: No kiddin'?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No.  Missing teenager.  Disappeared thirty years ago.  Found her bones last week.  Buried behind some old diner, up by Dyckman street.  Mary Finelli.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Huh.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Talk about dumb luck.  Odds of anybody finding that girl, thirty years later. And then the chances of hitting a dental...forget about it.  Bets part is she's the first victim.  She knew the doer.  I'm betting those bones are gonna do a lot of talking.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm the train wreck you didn't see coming.  And I'm gonna steal your life away.  You went down 30 years ago.  You just don't know it yet.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You're telling me this maniac is a cop? What the hell am I supposed to do with that one?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Call the FBI.  Use a pay phone.  Don't give 'em your name, Dad.  Just tell 'em that it was Shepard who killed Finelli and Clark and the others.  That he's the Nightingale.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay, I'm on it.  Hey.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Hello, Frank.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What are you doing here, Satch?  You off today?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Frank, we need to talk...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I'm in the middle of something important here.  You mind if...

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Frank, but you need to come outside.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Just a minute, John...okay?  Don't go away.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: I think you know, Frank.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No, I don't.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Let's go outside and talk.  We need to do that.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: About what?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Let's go.  Do us both a favor.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay.  Stay there, John.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Where were you last night, Frank?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Do you know where I found this?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No.  This isn't what you think.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: I wanna be wrong here.  But we need to go to the precinct and talk about it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay, okay.  I need to go say something to Julia and finish up with the guy on the radio.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: You can talk to Julia.  Forget the radio.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Trust me, Bud.  Do that for me.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: John, you there?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Satch is busting me for Sissy Clark's murder.  John...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: ...you gotta help me, Chief.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: That's not the deal, Frank.  Don't do this to your family.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Carl Shepard.  Detective out of the 15th precinct.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Uh, huh...  Uh, huh.  And you got this from the guy you were talking to on the radio when I came in?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: As nuts as that sounds, yes.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Uh, huh.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Satch, would you listen to me here.  Just you and me.  Can I talk to you here, alone?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Give me a little time with this guy.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He's not gonna stop, Satch.  He's gonna keep on...

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Are you listening to me?  You're in a world of shit.  An eye witness has you outside the dead girl's apartment.  We got your prints all over the place.  Plus the fucking driver's license, Frank.  You gotta give me something here. Something I can believe.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What if I could prove it to you, Satch?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: How's that?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What if I told you that in the bottom of the 6th we're gonna be down 3-0.  And Cleon Jones is gonna get hit in the foot. It's gonna leave a scuff mark on the ball.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Frank, please...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: The next batter, Clendenon, hits one outta the park.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Frank, this is insane...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: In the bottom of the 7th, Weis is gonna hit a solo home run.  Jones and Swoboda are gonna score in the 8th.  The Mets are gonna win 5-3.  Go watch the game, Satch.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Go watch the game?  Go watch the fucking game?  Frank, they're gonna make you for Sissy Clark's murderer.  It matches the Nightingale's profile.  You understand what that means?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: His wife is here.  She wants to talk to you.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Whatta you want me to tell her?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: She's in harm's way.  He's gonna be coming for her.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Let's walk, get a cup of coffee.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: You got a collar in here for the Nightingale murders?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: I'm working with one of the victims outta Brooklyn North.  You mind I take a shot at him?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: They around?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Where's the collar, in the cells?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: I'll go find Hayes.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: On your feet.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You twisted animal...

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Evidence says you're the animal.  That's why you hung yourself.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You try putting that thing around my neck and I'll rip your throat out.  You want me dead, use the gun.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Let me draw you a picture.  You live at 1060 41st Ave.  You have a wife who works at New York Hospital.  And a six-year old

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: What the hell is going on here?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You got to help me.  He's trying to kill me.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Mind if we take it outside?

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: ...didn't mean t step on your toes.  They sent me up from downstairs, I thought you'd be in there with him.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: What are you looking at him for?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Yeah, half the uniforms are either at the game or on the street.  It's gonna be a riot if they pull it off.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: What's the score?

Speaker: tv announcer
Dialogue: Hadges is coming outta the dug out.  He's calling for the ball.  Can we get a shot of the ball?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Can you excuse me for a second?

Speaker: tv announcer
Dialogue: There's a scuff mark on the ball!  The umpire has reversed his decision.  He's sending Jones to first base!

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: You mind I go back at teh fire boy for a while?  I won't lay a hand on him, just want to see what he's got?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Go ahead, knock yourself out.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: What's going on, Satch?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: He was right!  Everything he said.  He was telling the truth.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Then you believe him?

Speaker: satch
Dialogue: Yeah I do.  You bet your life I do.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Elvis has left the building.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Hell-

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You have the right to remain silent.  If you give up that right...

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Who the fuck is this?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

Speaker: shepard
Dialogue: Sullivan?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You have the right to speak to an att --

Speaker: shepard
